document_data.name: Gharizol
document_data.race: [[Barbed devil]]<ref group="note">''[[Day of the Devil]]'' page 7 refers to Gharizol as a [[bearded devil]], despite the fact he was previously listed as a [[barbed devil]]. Considering the creature stats for a barbed devil are included in the adventure, this was likely an oversight.
document_data.mainbody:
'''Gharizol''' ({{Pronounce|GARE|iz|OHL|refs=}}) was a [[barbed devil]] who lived in service to Archduke [[Zariel]]. He made it his calling to exact vengeance upon the mortals of [[Faer√ªn]] in her name, during the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]].

{{Quote|Welcome to Baldur's Gate. Thank you for brining them to me. You can have him now.|[[Gharizol]], possessing the body of [[Harwin Lamlin]].}}
document_data.Personality: Gharizol was consumed with power and wholly egomaniacal. He held nothing but utter contempt for mortals of the [[Realms]].
document_data.Abilities:
The fiendish being could communicate ''[[telepathy|telepathically]]'' with mortals, as well as temporarily possess their bodies and speak through their voices.

Like other barbed devils, Gharizol was resistant to the effects of cold, and was not easily harmed by non-[[Item enchantment|magical]] weapons. He could not be harmed by fire of flame, and was immune to the effects of all [[poison]]s.
document_data.Possessions: His only possession was a small leather pouch that held a single ''[[soul coin]]''.
document_data.Relationships: Gharizol was served by many of Zariel's cultists, including [[Vollis Foote]],{{Cite adventurers league/Escape from Elturgard|27}} and other unwitting servants like the unassuming [[Harwin Lamlin]].
